channel.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
channel.description:
I'm currently looking for a blank landscape.rscd file. The reason for is so that I can create an entirely new landscape. Right now, the only option that I can think of is completely erase the current landscape.rscd (found in clientconf folder) by hand. And this will take a while..
Does anyone have a similiar file? Or a editor that can edit multiple tiles at once?

item.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Should have made a script to rename the files automatically, could have been done sooo fast. But whatever, what’s done is done lol

Read full topic

So you did it the hard way. Dam. You must have a lot of time on your hands.
[/quote]

Mouse recorder helps a lot.

item.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
item.dc:creator: @nate_o nate o
item.description:
@nate_o wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:13, topic:308734”][quote author=nate o link=topic=405206.msg3000687#msg3000687 date=1255965658]

I suggest using adu’s idea. If you didn’t understand it, I can kind of recap it. Edit one sector of the map to completely empty with the landscape editor. Then save it. Then extract landscape.rscd, copy and paste the sector you edited blank over the other sectors and give it the appropriate name again. Then repack into landscape.rscd once all are replaced with blank sectors.

BTW before you try that it doesnt work, Ive tried before, all the tile ends up green for some reason after packing it.

It worked fine for me.
I have a blank map currently.

I’m debating whether or not to release. This would mean that a lot of servers would create custom map’s of their own off of this. And that’s what makes my idea unique.
[/quote]

Yeah because it’s so hard to delete the map and start from fresh? Naice![/quote]

I’m not saying it’s hard. It’s a pain in the ass renaming 1,700 files…

Read full topic

item.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
item.dc:creator: @nate_o nate o
item.description:
@nate_o wrote:

[quote=“adu, post:5, topic:308734”]Heres an idea, just replace one sector with all green (or whatever you want) save the one landscape sector. Then just c+p the saved sector and rename the file to the next sector you want blank. You can try making a script that will rename the files for you.

And it will prevent you from going into the editor a million times.[/quote]

I’m using Xents/Vrunks/Pets landscape editor. As far as I know, you can only copy and paste one tile.
Unless I’ve misunderstood what you’ve said.

Read full topic

item.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

Heres an idea, just replace one sector with all green (or whatever you want) save the one landscape sector. Then just c+p the saved sector and rename the file to the next sector you want blank. You can try making a script that will rename the files for you.

And it will prevent you from going into the editor a million times.

Read full topic

item.title: Blank Landscape.rscd file?
item.dc:creator: @nate_o nate o
item.description:
@nate_o wrote:

xx c1ph3r xx:

What does loading.rscd have to do with you making a new landscape. I don’t get it…

Landscape.data*
I don’t understand how to make a blank landscape that I can begin to edit. The only way that I can think of is use a landscape editor to manually remove every single tile by hand so that the map is blank and flat. Once that is complete, I can begin to make my landscape.

[quote=“meatstick, post:3, topic:308734”][quote author=xx c1ph3r xx link=topic=405206.msg2996249#msg2996249 date=1255624963]
What does loading.rscd have to do with you making a new landscape. I don’t get it…
[/quote]
Most probably a typo[/quote]
My mistake.

Read full topic
